RainbruRPG::Terminal::Window

RainbruRPG::Terminal::Window Class Reference

#include <window.h>

Collaboration diagram for RainbruRPG::Terminal::Window:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

A terminal window that can be added to the TerminalApp.

the focusWindow property defines if we are focusing the Window or its Widgets. We must toggle this property with the F11 key.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

RainbruRPG::Terminal::Window::Window ( const char *  c  ) 

The named constructor.

The window is created with a noarmel state, it is unselected. It initialize the ScrollingPanel and create a default FreeLayout.

void RainbruRPG::Terminal::Window::draw (  )  [virtual]

The draw() method inherited from Widget.

It draws the box according to the window stateand call the layout's draw() method.

It finally the Layout::draw() method.

tWindowState RainbruRPG::Terminal::Window::lastState [private]

The last state used by this window.

It is used to store the state before hidding it.

Definition at line 98 of file window.h.

bool RainbruRPG::Terminal::Window::selected [private]

Is the window selected.

If true (with focusWindow at true), the border is in green, otherwise, it is in white.
